text.tspan: Jake controls the largest oil system in virtually all of North
America. Fidelia is a nation that has grown and developed on
the back of its oil resources, so the refinery tower at its
center, the Fidelion, is a symbol of the entire Fidelian
Empire. The impact of the oil produced by the Fidelion is
beyond the average person's imagination, and in fact, it is an
indispensable resource for powering massive transport
systems, tanks, and even bipedal weaponry that require high
concentrations of energy. The need for these resources is
constant, both internally and externally, and is the source of
While the workers of Fidelia are the ones who actually run
the giant engine, the entire operation depends on Jake's
bureaucracy and military to be in the right place at the right
time. While this may appear to be an efficiently run
operation from the outside, it's a coercive structure that can
only be enforced under the iron fist of Jake's rule and citizens
who reject the labor structure within Fidelia can be deported
or even executed depending on the severity of their crime.
The shaft that supports the top of the tower is more than
just a structure, it is a representation of the forces that
support Fidelion. The underlying supports represent the
workers, engineers, troops, and soldiers that exist within the
Fidelian Empire, while the massive central support shaft
represents the giant drilling pipes that extract oil.
It is where Jake and his upper-class subjects
reside and are involved in all aspects of empire
operations and governance. It can be
considered the control tower of Empire Fidelia.
The top of the Fidelion Tower is an iconic
representation of Fidelia, and it houses a partially
operational oil refinery. It is more of an iconic
symbol of Fidelia than of any practical use. In reality,
the Fidelion Tower is always smoldering and smoky.
The Emperor Jake, overhauled the city's former vagrant-dominated neighborhoods and redesigned it as a planned city. As a result, Fidelia has a radial
city structure, with the borders of the eight districts radiating out from a round central district with a tower in the center of the city. In contrast to a
typical radial city, where each section is connected to the next, Fidelia has controlled movement between sections. Instead of roads, the radial
boundaries of the compartments are lined with concrete barriers, and there are checkpoints between the compartments, making it difficult to move
freely. In addition, a few compartments used for specialized purposes are completely gated off and inaccessible to the public.
In the early years of his reign, Emperor Jake was inspired by the proletarian revolution to create an economic structure
based on a "fair wage system based on labor" for his working-class citizens, which gained the support of many residents.
Although it cannot avoid the criticism that it protects and even deifies the imperial privileged class in that it wants to
clearly distinguish between its own residential area and that of the lower classes, it can also be seen as a somewhat
efficient social system that allows people to focus on their roles and thus increase their satisfaction. Unfortunately, as time
passes, this structure slowly degenerates from its original intentions, creating a social structure that is different from the
initial one, a social structure that is full of madness.
